intro: Maschalodesme simplex, commonly known as the simple maschalodesme, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, woody fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a relatively rare and less-studied species.
